page.title: 17SIBSON AIRFIELD
page.content: A sizeable part of the south-west corner of the Stibbington area contains the landing ground for Sibson Airfield. The airfield buildings contain the Peterborough Parachute Centre and the Peterborough Aero club and hangars house several small planes and gliders. The landing ground which covers over 300 acres serves as the target area for parachutists. The experts can often be seen gently floating to the ground, steering their 'chutes to land on the sand pit in the centre of the landing area, whilst more commonly the novices tumble groundwards hoping to land somewhere in the 300 acres. The unfortunates who do not succeed may find themselves on a road or a roof, in a pig farm or in a tree! Flying and parachuting activities draw increasing numbers of visitors.
